text: Westport Lake is a lake and local nature reserve in Stoke-on-Trent, in Staffordshire, England, about south of Tunstall. It is alongside the Trent and Mersey Canal. It is owned by the Canal and River Trust, and is operated by the Staffordshire Wildlife Trust and Stoke-on-Trent City Council."Westport Lake" Canal and River Trust. Retrieved 27 April 2020. There is a visitor centre, with a café and lakeside balcony. The centre has conference facilities."Westport Lake Visitor Centre" Staffordshire Wildlife Trust. Retrieved 27 April 2020. Staffordshire Wildlife Trust has two visitor centres; the other is the Wolseley Centre near Rugeley."Our visitor centres" Staffordshire Wildlife Trust. Retrieved 27 April 2020. The lake is the largest expanse of water in Stoke-on-Trent. There is a level footpath of about around the lake. There is waterfowl on the lake, and it is an overwintering site for many species. ==History== In the 1890s the lake was developed as a pleasure resort, but it later became a wasteland. It was an early landscape regeneration project of Stoke-on-Trent; it was opened in 1972 as a recreation and conservation area."Westport Lake, Stoke-on-Trent" Staffordshire Past Track.
